reviews.review_msg: She's very friendly and you can tell she's passionate about what she teaches but her exams are pretty difficult. 80% of it is fair but there will be a couple questions that make you mad because she's purposefully trying to trick you. She often makes announcements at the last minute which is annoying as some of us take an hour to get to class.

She is a queen, she taught 326 very well in my opinion. I recommend taking 326 with her if you get the chance, it is not an easy class but she does a pretty good job at teaching it. She is also very raw and real and you can tell she is constantly trying to improve and help us in any way she can. Great teacher overall

This prof has little command of the field she teaches in, nor does she teach well.  She is nearly impossible to reach, and takes a very cavalier attitude toward the lessons and readings.

Avoid her at all costs -- you won't learn much, and yet it is a time sinkhole.
Hard subject so expect class to be hard.

Diana is easily one of the best prof's at SFU. I had her for 326 and she was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful. More than anything, she's a wonderful person. Truly kind, caring, and inspirational. I highly highly highly recommend taking a course with her. She's so amazing!!!

She really knows the material and how to teach the material in an effective manner. I wish she could have taught all my courses, but that's apparently not how life works. I have a theory that she was created in a laboratory that creates incredible individuals to become the absolute top professor in her field. No evidence against it so far...

Diana is extremely personable. I struggled with this course as there is so much material to memorize but she really helped find comfort in discomfort. I did not do nearly as well as I had hoped but honestly you should study your flashcards RIGHT AWAY. This is by far the most challenging course I've taken simply due to the volume and expected detail

I took 326 with Diana. I found going to lecture to be very helpful in understanding terms, understanding physiological pathways.. She transmitted a lot of enthusiasm about the material which was very motivating to study harder. She tells you what type of qs there will be on the midtermfinal. will def take her again!
